
Eager to launch fast, Alice reused a prime in her RSA keys. Decrypt this intercepted message to reveal her secret: 2360341155789633826462824969937491671836967267773721400093497801973743117120699027553372594918425900951498356009422879637961685530822222408734691284292819


The flag format is flag{...}
n=5230088183958446328998389623148650999634869613137305490341549283482727257049239952314897688778174428955637492962964652780803981213188346518675673371727809, e=1141971622305841163962424322960673115929510098741387622312590027547229056502506524673811818873412595650299474006654403181173972767893017071622061340031713

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{c7ms49ay}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2360341155789633826462824969937491671836967267773721400093497801973743117120699027553372594918425900951498356009422879637961685530822222408734691284292819
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5230088183958446328998389623148650999634869613137305490341549283482727257049239952314897688778174428955637492962964652780803981213188346518675673371727809, e=1141971622305841163962424322960673115929510098741387622312590027547229056502506524673811818873412595650299474006654403181173972767893017071622061340031713
extra_info: p=72319348614035831406820671085717975208645360801285646912113481063713177212447, q=72319348614035831406820671085717975208645360801285646912113481063713177212447, Ï†(n)=5230088183958446328998389623148650999634869613137305490341549283482727257049095313617669617115360787613466057012547362059201409919364119556548247017302916
subtype: repeated_prime_usage
